Posts.Content: PastorRich wrote: My dear wife had her 3 year oncology checkup last week preceeded by a mammogram. The doc said "the mammogram was fine, but...." they wanted a compression mammogram and ultrasound. So that was today. With the ultrasound, the technician did the testing, then went to talk to the radiologist, then redid a spot (or two) again. No other details or comments except that we're now waiting for the report. I think this is not uncommon but it is very unnerving. Blessings to all, Rich  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Callback on mammogram PastorRich keepsmiling

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2008 04:07PM PastorRich wrote: It took me a while to get to that, but I did ask if the reason was scar tissue, and he said yes and mentioned something about "the geography" of the area had changed. It didn't occur until later that we should have asked for more detail. He did say that if a biopsy was needed then we would see the surgeon who had done the previous one.... so we may have been in information overload... Thansk, Rich
Posts.Title: Callback on mammogram PastorRich keepsmiling

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2008 04:03PM PastorRich wrote: All is well. Our oncologist called at 9:30am to give the "it's clear!" Thanks, everyone!
Posts.Title: Callback on mammogram PastorRich keepsmiling
